oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fairview CME: church side
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church side. The brick building's side features two bays of windows with brick sills. The sidewalk leads to a secondary entrance with a two-step stoop. A sign next to the entrance reads, "Warning: Vandalism of This Church is a Fed - State Crime; You Will Be Prosecuted." The parking lot sits to the side of the church. Asphalt shingles cover the cross-gabled roof.

Fairview Christian Methodist Episcopal Church was established on January 10, 1894. The current building dates from July 1, 1972. At the time of fieldwork, Kate S. Tagler served as pastor and William Godwin was the local minister.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
